title: Rural Innovation Network data
text:
The Center on Rural Innovation (CORI) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that partners with rural leaders across industries, across sectors and across the country to build tech economies that support scalable entrepreneurship and lead to more tech jobs in rural America.
These repositories are maintained by the Mapping and Data Analytics (MDA) team at CORI/RISI. Our team provides data, analytics and visualizations to support rural participation in the digital economy through scalable entrepreneurship and tech job growth in rural America. We aim to provide a better understanding of the forces and trends affecting rural America as we help communities chart a path to opportunity and prosperity through the tech economy.
We strive towards serving as the primary center of excellence advancing sustainable, economic opportunity and equity in rural America. We do this by providing expert spatial and statistical analysis, modernized visualization and tool development, credible technical subject matter expertise, and transparent documentation.
Follow our work by reading our blog and reviewing the following list of past projects:





Broadband - Broadband Equity Access and Deployment (BEAD) tool - Climate Risk Mapping


Research - Rural Aperture Project (RWJF) - Defining rural America - Who lives in rural America? Part 1 Part 2 - The equity of economic opportunity in rural America




Rural Innovation Network - Ascendium reports and data viz - Economic Development (ERC) tool


Rural Innovation Initiative - Tech Economy Diagnostic (TED)  (i.e., community assessment → ERC tool)




Tech Entrepreneurship  - Feasibility studies - Tech Talent Tracker → ERC tool


Additional work - Economic Development Administration (EDA) reports - Economic impact analysis - Multistate Workforce Analysis - example - Who Is Missing Analysis



Learn more about the MDA approach to Knowledge here: Research, mapping, and data analytics

title: Tableau Dependencies Fix Summary
text:
The project cori.data.rin.frontend had the same issue as impact-dashboard: - Using @tableau/embedding-api npm package with missing internal dependencies - Causing Uncaught SyntaxError: Unexpected token 'export' errors in browser






✅ Removed problematic import: import { SheetType, TableauEventType } from "@tableau/embedding-api"
✅ Added global access: Now accesses TableauEventType and SheetType from window object
✅ Added TypeScript ignores: Used @ts-ignore for global Tableau objects loaded via CDN
✅ Maintained functionality: All existing JWT token generation and visualization logic preserved





✅ Added Tableau CDN script: <script type="module" src="https://us-east-1.online.tableau.com/javascripts/api/tableau.embedding.3.latest.min.js"></script>
✅ Proper loading order: Script loads before the React app initializes





✅ Removed npm dependency: Deleted "@tableau/embedding-api": "^3.11.1" from devDependencies
✅ Cleaner dependencies: No more problematic npm package that had missing internal deps





src/@cori-risi/components/TableauViz.tsx.backup
index.html.backup
package.json.backup






✅ No more build errors: Eliminates ES module syntax errors
✅ Official Tableau approach: Uses Tableau’s recommended CDN method
✅ Maintained functionality: All existing features still work
✅ Cleaner dependencies: Removed problematic npm package
✅ Better performance: CDN loading is more reliable than bundled dependencies





src/@cori-risi/components/TableauViz.tsx - Removed npm imports, added global access
index.html - Added Tableau CDN script
package.json - Removed problematic dependency

The fix follows the same pattern successfully applied to the impact-dashboard project.
